subject: p10933609
History: Acute respiratory failure, intubated patient. Bilateral upper extremity fractures.
Findings: Comparison is made with prior study. Cardiac size is top normal. New opacities in the lower lobes bilaterally and worsening consolidations in the perihilar regions right greater than left and right upper lobe are consistent with aspiration. There is some component of basilar atelectasis. ET tube is in a standard position 45 cm above the carina. There is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.
